channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Report ref: 8699478, 17th February
item.description:
I am writing to provide an urgent update regarding the ongoing flooding issue I first reported on 16/01/26 (Report Ref: 8699478). Over the past weekend, an HGV encountered the floodwater, resulting in a collision with and subsequent damage to the road barrier. The flooding has now breached both lanes, creating a severe hazard for all motorists. Given that a HGV typically weighing between 3,400 kg and 20,000 kg was unable to navigate this safely, the risk to standard passenger vehicles is extreme. It is deeply concerning that this incident occurred a full month after the site was officially flagged as hazardous. Could you please provide a formal update on the following: What immediate actions are being taken to clear the standing water? What is the timeline for permanent remedial works to prevent further accidents? How is the council addressing the safety risks that have persisted since my initial report? I look forward to your prompt response and a resolution to this public safety matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light outside 4 Allison Grove not working, 17th February
item.description:
Light is not working- and my entire front garden and street along front of my house is pitch black at night. I have concerns about cars being broken into. My dad also has heart failure and bad knees and it’s difficult to see anything at night when stepping down onto our walkway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Allison Grove, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Warren Street tube station, 17th February
item.description:

item.title: Treeroots causing uneven footway, 17th February
item.description:
